meanings.sent1: The old car was clankier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: The metal gate was clankier than the wooden fence.
meanings.sent3: The clankier noise of the pots and pans clashing together made the kitchen feel alive.
meanings.sent4: The clankier sound of the hammer hitting the anvil echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The clankier bell on the cat's collar could be heard from far away.

meanings.sent1: The clankier pipes in the old building rattled with every gust of wind.
meanings.sent2: The clankier tools in the toolbox were difficult to use quietly.
meanings.sent3: The clankier sound of the wind chimes in the storm created a spooky atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The clankier notes of the piano added a unique texture to the music.
meanings.sent5: The clankier door hinges squeaked loudly whenever someone entered the room.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, metallic sound
meanings.sent1: The rusty gate clankiered as it swung open.
meanings.sent2: The pots and pans clankiered loudly as they fell off the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The old car clankiered down the road, drawing attention from passersby.
meanings.sent4: The blacksmith clankiered the red-hot metal against the anvil.
meanings.sent5: The wind clankiered the loose shutters against the window frame all night long.
